description:
Given a binary tree return the count of leaf nodes(nodes which have no children in the tree.

For example: Given the Binary Tree

         1
       /   \
      2       3
     /    
    6

The number of leaf nodes would be two which are 6 and 3.

Input Format:

A single line that represents the value of the nodes and the value of '- 1' denotes NULL node.

Output Format:

Return a single integer representing the number of leaf nodes.

Sample input:
1 2 3 -1 -1 -1 -1

Sample output:
2

Constraints:

0 <= N <= 10^4

0 <= data <= 10^3

Where 'N' denotes the total number of nodes and 'data' denotes the value of the node
title: Leafs of Binary Tree
